name: Nanotwitter
body:
### Assignment
The purpose of this project was to build a lightweight Twitter clone written in Ruby that was well engineered and scalable. Our goal was to create a service that could support thousands of users following one another and posting, liking, and replying to tweets. The resulting application is hosted [Heroku](http://secret-shelf-78111.herokuapp.com/front) and uses a Postgres database and a Redis cache provided by Heroku. 

To run your own copy of our nanoTwitter service, all you need to do is clone the repository, push it to a Heroku application with a database and Redis set up, and perform the initial database rake. Enjoy!

### Screenshots


### Technology
nanoTwitter is written in Ruby and utilizes a Sinatra framework, a more lightweight framework than Rails. 



### Authors and Contributors
nanoTwitter was written by Anne Charnes (@timetwister4), Shaul Vin (@b7q), and Tristan Ramirez de Haro (@tristanibus) in the Fall of 2016. This project would not have been possible without the guidance and encouragement of our Professor, Pito Salas, and our teaching assistant, Karishma Khan.
